column1: Such  legitimate expectations  may  arise  where  a public  authority has  made  a clear,  unqualified
and  unambiguous representation to a particular individual that it will act in a particular way. The
burden  is  on  the  individual  to demonstrate  that an  unqualified,  unambiguous  and  unqualified
representation  was  made [Clive  Lewis, Judicial Remedies in  Public Law,  5t h  Ed.,  248  (South Asian
